description:
The Amerada trail circum navigates Crimson Lake. 
Crimson Lake Provincial park meeting place of foothills forests in the west, bog and muskeg in the north and aspen parkland in the east; visitors can enjoy a variety of outdoor experiences, abundant wildlife such as moose and deer, and the solitude of dense evergreen forests.
It's a pleasant a relatively easy ride through a variety of forest zones.
We did encounter two fallen trees and a couple of wet sections.
directions: Head west from Rocky Mountain House on highway 11, the north on 756, to the signed entrance to Crimson Lake Provincial park
title: Amerada
